gcci.text: With H100 prices averaging $3.16/hr, supply tightness is easing but capex remains elevated as buyers secure longer-term contracts to hedge against intermittent chip availability and rising downstream integration costs.

gtpi.text: Average input tokens at $1.25/1M signal aggressive API price competition; efficiency-focused models and smaller context windows are winning workloads while premium providers rely on multi-turn differentiation to sustain margins.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load places sustained pressure on grids, increasing the business case for nuclear and advanced metering to balance load while moderating the carbon footprint of AI-driven demand.

aipi.text: Sentiment is buoyant as inference costs fall and workloads expand, but overcapacity in compute and model layers raises bubble risk; sustainability depends on disciplined capex and visible, monetizable product use cases.
